title: Finzean Tom's Cairn Walk Route

images.title: Stanley Howe / Houses in Finzean village
images.caption: Houses in Finzean village. Finzean is a pleasant rural village known for its picturesque landscapes and links to the Scottish artist Joseph Farquharson. The area is part of the Birse Parish and features a mix of farmland, forestry, and upland terrain.

images.title: Nigel Corby / Tom's Cairn
images.caption: Tom's Cairn. This cairn-topped hill offers panoramic views of the surrounding countryside, including glimpses of the River Dee and Cairngorm mountains. The route to the summit is accessible and family-friendly, making it a rewarding short hike.

images.title: Nigel Corby / The edge of Corsedardar Wood
images.caption: The edge of Corsedardar Wood

images.title: Colin Smith / Birse and Feughside Kirk
images.caption: Birse and Feughside Kirk

images.title: Paul Chapman / Forestry track near the Backbog burn
images.caption: Forestry track near the Backbog burn

description: This circular walk visits a splendid viewpoint near the village of Finzean in Aberdeenshire. You can start the walk from the parking area in the village and head west to the old church. Here you will pass along some peaceful woodland trails before looping round to climb Tom's Cairn. From the 310 metre high hill there are some excellent views over the surrounding countryside, hills and forestry. The hill is located just west of Banchory where you can enjoy a pleasant riverside walk along the River Dee and watch the leaping salmon at the Falls of Feugh .
display_address: Finzean Hall, B976, Finzean, Aberdeenshire, Alba / Scotland, AB31 6LY, United Kingdom
